Do the private lives of politicians matter?

Boris Johnson and Chris Huhne have both had very public personal lives but the difference this makes to their politics is uncertain.

Should we really be applauding Obama?

Hussein Kesvani asks if we can really applaud Obama's sense of humour in light of his repeated failures to turn around his nation's defence record

The government last week suggested that some rich pensioners should hand back their benefits. Adam Highland looks at whether the wealthy elderly should keep their welfare payments

Across Europe parties of varying ideological backgrounds are calling into question the the unelected bodies of the European Court and Commission, Hungary is no exception

Is Ed Miliband holding back Labour?

In a recent article written for The New Statesman, Tony Blair argued that the Labour Party must not "settle back into its old territory of defending the status quo" and remain "as the party opposing 'Tory cuts'

Marriage tax breaks should go ahead

David Cameron has assured supporters that proposals for a stay-at-home member of a married couple/civil partnership to be able to transfer PS750 of their tax-free personal allowance to their working spouse will indeed be fulfilled

In a political climate where political parties all seem to merge into one, Raphael Reuben assesses whether you can truly position oneself in the political spectrum

Lorin Bell-Cross argues that UKIP's upsurge can no longer be dismissed as a negative reaction to the coalition and that they are fast developing into a substantial political force

Ultimately they are vital in making decisions about how these areas function

Since 1992, the Conservative Party has failed to win an election outright. Josh Allen assesses the reasons for the decline of Tory England

One of Britain's boldest Prime Ministers has today passed away, leaving a legacy that will be debated throughout history. Sam Shepherd looks at how Mrs Thatcher will be remembered

With Tunisian group Femen declaring the 4th April as International Topless Jihad Day, Rosie Shields assesses the benefits of this in light of the ongoing struggle of women in Arab countries

We need every Commonwealth country and our leaders to follow the example of the Canadian Prime Minister and boycott the event if the summit goes ahead in Colombo

The date has been announced, and despite the political intentions behind the timing, the real debate must begin with much more substance required from the 'Yes' campaign.
